name: Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese
author: Matt R
summary: I saw my local ballpark was introducing Buffalo chicken mac and cheese and thought it was a great idea! This is what I whipped up. Serve with celery sticks and beer. Let me know what you think.
ingredients: ½ cup hot sauce (such as Frank's® Redhot®), or more to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, 8 minutes
Cut wings and legs off rotisserie chicken
Skin and bone wings and legs; chop or shred dark meat into bite-size pieces
Melt butter in a large Dutch oven over medium heat
Whisk in flour gradually until a thick paste forms
Pour in milk, whisking constantly, until thickened and bubbling, about 5 minutes
Continue to cook until sauce is smooth, about 1 minute more
Reduce heat and season sauce with black pepper
Stir Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheese into the sauce until melted and combined
Stir in hot sauce, adjusting to reach desired level of spiciness
Add blue cheese, chicken, and macaroni; mix well to combine
